verse:
तत्र तत्राञ्जसायुष्मन् भवता यद्विनिश्चितम् ।
पुंसामेकान्ततः श्रेयस्तन्नः शंसितुमर्हसि ॥

terms.āyuṣman: blessed with a long duration of life

vedabase.translation: Please, therefore, being blessed with many years, explain to us, in an easily understandable way, what you have ascertained to be the absolute and ultimate good for the people in general.
vedabase.purport: In Bhagavad-gītā, worship of the ācārya is recommended. The ācāryas and gosvāmīs are always absorbed in thought of the well-being of the general public, especially their spiritual well-being. Spiritual well-being is automatically followed by material well-being. The ācāryas therefore give directions in spiritual well-being for people in general. Foreseeing the incompetencies of the people in this Age of Kali, or the iron age of quarrel, the sages requested that Sūta Gosvāmī give a summary of all revealed scriptures because the people of this age are condemned in every respect. The sages, therefore, inquired of the absolute good, which is the ultimate good for the people. The condemned state of affairs of the people of this age is described as follows.

terms.अर्हसि: you are capable, you should consider

terms.tatra añjasā āyuṣman bhavatā: that alone , indeed , O hero , by you
terms.yat viniścitam puṁsām ekāntataḥ śreyaḥ: the highest good of men has been decided
terms.tat naḥ śaṁsitum arhasi: that you should declare to us

bard.meaning: that alone , indeed , O hero , by you the highest good of men has been decided that you should declare to us
